page.title: 12Wrinstone cont'd
page.content: In 1536-39 John Leland described the castle as "Being all in ruine saving one high tower". The farm today is owned by the Rees family. Other prominent features include the Beauville and the Ysguborgoch farms, which were also part of the Medieval Wrinstone estate. Today the Beauville farm is primarily concerned with mixed stock and hay production. During the 19th century, the tithe or red barn served as a slaughterhouse for the whole of the Wenvoe area. Part of the Beauville farmhouse is actually of Tudor origin, when it was used as a fortified manor-house. The origin of the name Beauville is a mystery but between 1500 and the present day it was spelt "Bove Hill" meaning "farm under the hill".
